doc1.title: What is Internet-in-a-Box
doc1.content: Internet-in-a-Box is a portable offline knowledge server containing datasets like Wikipedia, documentation, and learning content to provide access when connectivity is unavailable. It includes search, retrieval, and lightweight collaboration over a LAN.

doc2.title: Deploying the system
doc2.content: To deploy Internet-in-a-Box, copy the package to a small server, run the index builder, and start the HTTP server. Optionally enable local network sharing and periodic sync when connectivity returns.

doc3.title: Search and retrieval
doc3.content: The system provides full-text search with ranked results and snippets. Indexes are small and can be rebuilt from local JSON content or imported dumps when online.
